bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Distribution without consent and threat of distribution

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person commits an unlawful act that is actionable without proof of damage if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: distributes an intimate image depicting an individual, without the consent of the individual, or
threatens to distribute an intimate image depicting an individual.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Distribution of an intimate image without the consent of the individual is lawful if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Not in force.]

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a law enforcement investigation,
a court proceeding or a tribunal proceeding, or
activities that are necessarily incidental to an investigation referred to in subparagraph (i) or a proceeding referred to in subparagraph (ii).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual who consented to the distribution of an intimate image depicting the individual may revoke consent to that distribution at any time.

the person who distributed the intimate image must make every reasonable effort to make the intimate image unavailable to others.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application for expedited intimate image protection order

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual who is depicted in an intimate image that has been distributed by another person without the individual's consent, or who is depicted in an intimate image and is threatened with the distribution of the intimate image, may apply for relief under this section.

In an application under subsection (1), if the applicant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the applicant and that a person other than the applicant and who is not a respondent distributed the intimate image without the applicant's consent, the decision maker, after considering any prescribed factors, may do any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: determine that the intimate image was distributed without the applicant's consent;
order the person who distributed the intimate image to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: delete or destroy all copies of the intimate image in the person's possession or control, and
make every reasonable effort to make the intimate image unavailable to others, including by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: having the intimate image removed from any platform operated by an internet intermediary and from any other electronic form of application, software, database and communication method, and
having the intimate image de-indexed from any search engine;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: order an internet intermediary or other person or organization to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: remove the intimate image from any platform operated by the internet intermediary and from any other electronic form of application, software, database or communication method,
delete or destroy the intimate image, and
de-index the intimate image from any search engine;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: order a person to provide any information the decision maker considers necessary to further the objectives of removal, deletion, destruction or de-indexing of the intimate image;
make any other order the decision maker considers just and reasonable in the circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In an application under subsection (1), if the applicant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the applicant and that a respondent distributed the intimate image without the applicant's consent, the decision maker, after considering any prescribed factors, may do either or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: determine that the distribution was unlawful;
subject to any regulations, make any determination or order that the decision maker may make under subsection (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In an application under subsection (1), if the applicant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the applicant and that a person other than the applicant and who is not a respondent threatened to distribute the intimate image, the decision maker, after considering any prescribed factors, may do any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: determine that the threat was made;
order the person who threatened to distribute the intimate image to refrain from distributing the intimate image;
order the person who threatened to distribute the intimate image to delete or destroy all copies of the intimate image in the person's possession or control;
make any other order the decision maker considers just and reasonable in the circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In an application under subsection (1), if the applicant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the applicant and that a respondent threatened to distribute the intimate image, the decision maker, after considering any prescribed factors, may do either or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: determine that the threat was unlawful;
subject to any regulations, make any determination or order that the decision maker may make under subsection (4).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application under subsection (1) may be made without notice.
A party or other person affected by a determination or order made under this section may ask the decision maker that made the determination or order to cancel the determination or order.

in:desc: [defence to application for expedited intimate image protection order]
bcl:text.#text: A party or other person who makes a request under subsection (7) is to be considered a respondent for the purposes of sections 9  and 10 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A determination or order made under this section, or a related decision of the tribunal, must not include the name of an individual unless the individual was a respondent to the application.

An individual who is depicted in an intimate image that has been distributed by another person without the individual's consent or who is depicted in an intimate image and is threatened with the distribution of the intimate image may claim relief under this section.

In a claim under subsection (1), if the claimant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the claimant and that a respondent distributed the intimate image without the claimant's consent, the decision maker may do either or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to any regulations, make any determination or order that the decision maker may make under section 5;
order the respondent to pay damages, including compensatory, aggravated and punitive damages and any prescribed damages, in accordance with any regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In a claim under subsection (1), if the claimant satisfies the decision maker that the image is an intimate image depicting the claimant and that a respondent threatened to distribute the intimate image, the decision maker may do either or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to any regulations, make any determination or order that the decision maker may make under section 5;
order the respondent to pay damages, including compensatory, aggravated and punitive damages and any prescribed damages, in accordance with any regulations;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a determination or order under subsection (2) or (3), the decision maker is not bound by any determination or order made in an application under section 5 arising from the same facts.

A person in a prescribed class may, in accordance with any regulations, make an application under section 5 on behalf of a deceased individual respecting an intimate image in which the individual is depicted.
In an application made on behalf of a deceased individual, the decision maker must apply the following presumptions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the deceased individual did not consent to the distribution, if any, of the intimate image;

bcl:text.#text: that the deceased individual would not have made a request under section 13 (1) (b) .

bcl:text.in:desc: [regulations of the Lieutenant Governor in Council]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to any regulations, a minor who has reached the age prescribed under section 21 (2) (g)  may make an application under section 5 to the tribunal respecting an intimate image in which the minor is depicted.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person in a prescribed class may, if authorized by the individual depicted in an intimate image, and in accordance with any regulations, make an application to the tribunal under section 5 on behalf of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a minor who is depicted in the intimate image and has reached the age prescribed under section 21 (2) (i), and
an adult who is depicted in the intimate image.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Under sections 5 and 6, a respondent has the burden of proving that the image is not an intimate image because the individual depicted in the image did not have a reasonable expectation of privacy in the image at the following times, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the image is a recording, at the time it was recorded, and, if distributed, at the time of the distribution;
if the image is a simultaneous representation, at the time the simultaneous representation occurred.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Defence to application for expedited intimate image protection order
bcl:section.bcl:text: A respondent is not liable under section 5 if the respondent proves that the respondent had the consent of the individual depicted in the intimate image to distribute the intimate image, at the time when and to the extent that the intimate image was distributed by the respondent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A respondent is not liable under section 6 if the respondent proves that, as applicable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the respondent had, or honestly and reasonably believed that the respondent had, the consent of the individual depicted in the intimate image to distribute the intimate image, at the time when and to the extent that the intimate image was distributed by the respondent, or
the distribution was in the public interest and did not extend beyond what was in the public interest.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, a distribution is not in the public interest solely because the individual depicted in the intimate image is a public figure.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An internet intermediary is not liable under section 5 or 6 if the internet intermediary has taken reasonable steps to address the unlawful distribution of intimate images in the use of its services.

bcl:text.in:desc: [application to Supreme Court for injunctive relief]
bcl:text.#text: In an application under section 5, a claim under section 6 or an application under section 15 , as applicable, the decision maker must order a ban on publication of the name of the applicant or claimant, as applicable, or other information likely to identify the applicant or claimant, unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant or claimant was an adult at the time of the distribution or threat of distribution,
the applicant or claimant requests that there not be a publication ban, and
there are no other reasons to protect the identity of the applicant or claimant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In an application under section 5 or a claim under section 6, as applicable, the decision maker must order a ban on publication of the name of a respondent, or other information likely to identify the respondent, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the respondent was a minor at the time of the distribution or threat of distribution, or
there are other reasons to protect the identity of the respondent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A publication ban ordered under subsection (1) or (2)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may protect the identities of all of the parties,

must, in the case of an applicant or claimant, as applicable, or respondent, who was a minor at the time of the distribution or threat of distribution, and subject to any regulations, continue once the applicant or claimant or respondent is no longer a minor, and
may otherwise be in effect for a period of time determined by the decision maker.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a decision under subsection (1) that a publication ban will not be ordered in a claim under section 6, the decision maker is not bound by any publication ban ordered in an application under section 5 arising from the same facts.

bcl:text: may, at any time, in accordance with any regulations, ask the decision maker that ordered the publication ban to cancel the order.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is an adult and was an applicant or a claimant, or
made an application on behalf of a deceased individual

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In an application under subsection (5), the decision maker hearing the application must consider any prescribed factors.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the tribunal has made an order under section 5 against a respondent, the order may be filed in the Supreme Court, and the filed order is enforceable as if it were an order of the Supreme Court.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to Supreme Court for injunctive relief

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On application by any person, the Supreme Court may grant an injunction restraining a person from contravening an order made under section 5 if the court is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that a person has contravened or is likely to contravene an order made under section 5.
An application under this section may be made without notice.
The Supreme Court may grant an interim injunction until the disposition of an application under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The tribunal may order a person to pay an administrative penalty if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tribunal determines that the person has failed to comply with an order made under section 5, and
the person is given an opportunity to be heard in relation to the administrative penalty before the administrative penalty is ordered.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An administrative penalty for a failure to comply referred to in section 16 must not exceed the prescribed amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who is ordered to pay an administrative penalty must pay the administrative penalty to the government in accordance with the regulations.
On the date that an administrative penalty is payable under subsection (1), the penalty constitutes a debt payable to the government by the person ordered to pay the administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person may be ordered to pay an administrative penalty regardless of whether there is or has been a civil or criminal proceeding arising from the same contravention.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Time limit for ordering administrative penalty
bcl:section.bcl:text: An administrative penalty under this Part must not be ordered more than 2 years after the date the contravention of the order made under section 5 is alleged to have occurred.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations of the Lieutenant Governor in Council

bcl:text.#text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: restricting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the remedies available under section 5 (2) that may be awarded under section 5 (3),
the remedies available under section 5 (4) that may be awarded under section 5 (5), and
the remedies available for an application under section 5 that may be awarded in a claim under section 6;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing the factors the tribunal must consider in determining an application under section 5;
prescribing the factors the Supreme Court must consider in determining an application under section 5;
prescribing the factors a decision maker must consider in determining a claim under section 6;
prescribing additional types of damages that may be ordered under section 6;
prescribing the methods by which each type of damages that may be ordered under section 6 is to be calculated, with power to prescribe different methods for different types;
prescribing the age at which a minor may make an application under section 5 on the minor's own behalf;
restricting the circumstances in which a minor who has reached the age prescribed under paragraph (g) may make an application under section 5 on the minor's own behalf;
prescribing the age at which a minor may authorize a person in a prescribed class to make an application under section 5 on the minor's behalf;

restricting the circumstances in which a minor who has reached the age prescribed under paragraph (i) may authorize a person in a prescribed class to make an application under section 5 on the minor's behalf;
prescribing the classes of persons who, if authorized, may make an application under section 5 on behalf of a minor who has reached the prescribed age;
prescribing the classes of persons who, if authorized, may make an application under section 5 on behalf of an adult;
prescribing the classes of persons who may make an application under section 5 on behalf of a deceased individual;

prescribing procedures and practices relating to applications under section 5 made on behalf of minors, with power to prescribe different practices and procedures for different ages of minors and different circumstances;
prescribing procedures and practices relating to applications under section 5 made on behalf of adults;
prescribing procedures and practices relating to applications under section 5 made on behalf of deceased individuals;
prescribing procedures and practices relating to cancellations of publication bans;
establishing the circumstances in which a publication ban is not required to remain in effect after a respondent is no longer a minor;
prescribing the factors the tribunal must consider in determining whether to cancel a publication ban;

bcl:text.#text: prescribing the factors the Provincial Court, within the meaning of the , must consider in determining whether to cancel a publication ban;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing the factors the Supreme Court must consider in determining whether to cancel a publication ban;
prescribing, respecting administrative penalties,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the maximum amounts of administrative penalties the tribunal may order, with power to prescribe different amounts for first contraventions and subsequent contraventions and with power to prescribe different amounts for contraventions by individuals and contraventions by internet intermediaries and other persons and organizations,
the processes, forms and timelines relating to applications to order or cancel administrative penalties,
the factors the tribunal must consider in determining

bcl:clause.bcl:text: whether to order an administrative penalty, and
the amount of an administrative penalty that may be ordered,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the time period in which an administrative penalty is due and payable, and
the methods by which an administrative penalty is payable.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The rights and remedies under this Act are in addition to any other right or remedy that may be available to an applicant, a claimant or a respondent.
On the date this Act is brought into force, this Act applies to the following that occur on or after the date this Act receives First Reading in the Legislative Assembly:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a distribution of an intimate image depicting an individual, without the individual's consent;
a threat to distribute an intimate image depicting an individual.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
